title: ISic000108. Dedication for a local patron by the decurions
body:
1[---]yriṃ [---pa-]
2 [tr] ono [optimo or-]
3[d]o dec [urion-]
4 [u] m pecun[ia pub(lica) ob]
5multa merị[ta er-]
6g̣a rem public[am f(ecit)]
7ex d(ecreto) d(ecurionum)

1[---]YRI.[---..]
2[..]ONO[........]
3[.]ODEC[.....]
4[.]MPECUN[........]
5MULTAMER.[....]
6.AREMPUBLIC[....]
7EXDD

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text from autopsy, read against Bivona (1994);
  • 1: Bivona (1994) asserts an unclear 'm' at the end of the visible line 1, but 'a' is equally possible.
  • 6: Bivona (1994) reads 'ga' at the beginning of the visible line 6, but the 'g' is heavily obscured; potentially an 's' instead.

English translation

Alex Antoniou

[---] the most excellent patron. The order of decurions built [this] with public money, on account of his many merits directed towards the state, by decree of the decurions.

commentary

As stressed by Bivona (1994, 140-141) the top line(s) likely mentioned the recipient of the dedication. Although Bivona (1994) makes extensive restorations, they fit the dimensions of the stone and make sense of the immensely fragmentary text.

bibliography

  • 1994.0773 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283
  • 26 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002137
  • Belvedere 1982 37 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002161
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
